body:
can I suggest to add the **[Surface Outside Face Incident Solar Radiation Rate per Area [W/m2]](http://bigladdersoftware.com/epx/docs/8-7/input-output-reference/group-thermal-zone-description-geometry.html#surface-outside-face-incident-solar-radiation-rate-per-area-wm2)** output variable to the **readEPSrfResult** component so that we can get the irradiance value of the surface we want to study, e.g. windows for BiPV related investigation? 



Currently, it seems that when this output variable is added to **simulationOutput**, the **readEPSrfResult** component is unable to read the result file and consider this variable as "**otherSurfaceData**".



- Ji
topic: [suggestion] add surface incident solar radiation in the read surface result component

replies.body: The following is what I encountered: 1.  add **[Surface Outside Face Incident Solar Radiation Rate per Area [W/m2]](http://bigladdersoftware.com/epx/docs/8-7/input-output-reference/group-thermal-zone-description-geometry.html#surface-outside-face-incident-solar-radiation-rate-per-area-wm2)** output variable: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/KABHGMdqTOORe8EiYhedwj3EOHLdUZaqtZL7wn6mvi7m*JEe2Bh71Ck2QxZRB42lpnn-AUDgPEpt53lpbUNroEcsBaZ2vCqt/Image67.png) 2. This output variable is generated in the result file for each surface: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/KABHGMdqTOP4*5-5lj9b8Ctgj4zvNtxIR4-t6WtGIjHIaQLhWD1FdyfAt94zkz6CPLixMLTqit3hVZYThNawh1ib9PgePdPz/Image66.png) 3. However, the **readEPSrfResult** component cannot recognize this variable: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/KABHGMdqTONZhHoTmWaRVOuN3M65lscrnOwYkLT-VCoXxirSAEyOLYVY3wudBz7p41ppLD0-nWixlm6mWFtMEnDoWAX41igy/Image68.png) 4. Nevertheless, for unknown strange reason, I'm unable to reproduce the above warning for this test file later, and it seems that this variable can be read by the **readEPSrfResult** component, for now.... [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/KABHGMdqTOPY1Wc2bL1LqNg30NZbKcw2aEFHn0qs2Zq8WbZ5l6qv5Z2WLE6gZLWbRRGJW2cWmix5--UHx9I6FMpZK8Whik-A/Image69.png) 5. I got the same warning in other GH file I'm testing which included the surface irradiance as output variable. So, I'm not sure why the warning is not consistent across different files ... Appreciate if you can kindly advise.

two copies of the **readEPSrfResult** components reading the same result file, one can read correctly, whereas the other got a warning... strangely ... [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/PyPlrJLAwZdQ*jYohFtgHjjkal2Ybe5JMyfm5SVdlRkhLA1GSUlUum1eToacXA4dw0mx83rfbFgy6UT9TEXWigpaf6Y0QLeN/Image2.png) Has anybody encountered similar issue? Quite frustrated as it doesn't make sense ...

Hi Grasshope,

This is indeed very strange. I will let Chris know about this. He knows better than I about this components. If he ended up being busy I will take a look.

Mostapha

Grasshope, I'll need a bit of time to investigate the strangeness but I think it results from the fact that I have already built the surface result reader to automatically import transmitted solar energy, which you see is an output that you can request on the Genrate EP Output component: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/HI85JtglDarQJKF9C9d5wngVw6XAkMzWxdMVGpoCmnjurAr9NDuHpZMMjOJUn1MVVgPT06eDB3nvbGeQIOCTsF2A-GM7oWRQ/GlazingSolarAnalysis.JPG) and is meant to come in on the Read EP Surface Result component: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/HI85JtglDap1mgjpmBScXslTy9bd97YXPfRB-Pco7umhUyfC*fRnaNkQWPEytexrCZ8qlZMplcbTPU7xsKpY3Ss4g90Viy0A/GlazingSolarOutputs.JPG) The incident solar energy must be messing with the functions that process the transmitted solar energy and I'll try to correct his when I get the chance. -Chris

Thanks, Chris. It seems that if the **[Surface Outside Face Incident Solar Radiation Rate per Area [W/m2]](http://bigladdersoftware.com/epx/docs/8-7/input-output-reference/group-thermal-zone-description-geometry.html#surface-outside-face-incident-solar-radiation-rate-per-area-wm2)** output variable is included in the simulation, **readEPSrfResult** might be able to read it correctly the first time, but once I copy and paste this component there is the warning: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/KKxcsif2Kp0*glQcFvQjrdWiZ0WoQbAeUK3eZwpLlTbPbjxH-r87lGwMv7Dfl2xEZt820UM8zJngK*1OMPCJ8P58dRdAVrGu/Image5.png)
